record.title: ORDERS FOR FRIDAY, OCTOBER 26, 2007
record.narrative:
ORDERS FOR FRIDAY, OCTOBER 26, 2007 -- (Senate - October 25, 2007)

[Page: S13464]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that when the Senate completes its business today, it stand adjourned until 9:30 a.m., Friday, October 26; that on Friday, following the prayer and the pledge, the Journal of proceedings be approved to date, the morning hour be deemed to have expired, and the time for the two leaders be reserved for their use later in the day; that the Senate then resume consideration of Calendar No. 158, S. 294, Amtrak authorization; that at 10 a.m., the Senate proceed to a period of morning business, with Senators permitted to speak therein for up to 10 minutes each; that during morning business, Senator Dodd be recognized for up to 20 minutes, Senator Dorgan up to 30 minutes, and Senator Inhofe up to 2 hours.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
